Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there! üëã

Are you an ambitious Machine Learning engineer? Do you want to use your data science and engineering skills to help fast-growing tech scale-ups by means of ML? Furthermore, are you ready for the adventure of expanding Enjins together with our ambitious team? Then keep reading!

About Us üöÄ

At Enjins, we're committed to building AI solutions for meaningful change. We do this for customers in industries where a positive change can be made: Climate tech, Mobility and Marketplaces. Our portfolio includes partnerships with renowned names like Crisp, Groendus, SnappCar, Tier Mobility, Independer, PlanBlue (check our cases page for examples of our work).

With our headquarters in the Netherlands (Utrecht) and a second hub in Berlin we have shown impressive growth year-over-year, a proven proposition that fits current market needs, and a strong branding that resembles quality, innovation, and pragmatism. In 2024, we'll continue to invest in expanding our sales team within the Utrecht Hub to further grow our reach in the Dutch scale-up ecosystem. As the AI industry is booming, we have ambitious goals for the coming years ahead. From this hub, our ML engineers develop innovative AI solutions in collaboration with various scale-up customers.

At Enjins, our success hinges upon the quality of our team and the breadth of their ideas. We believe that truly remarkable insights and innovative solutions for our customers emerge from the rich interplay of diverse cultures, knowledge, and experiences among our workforces.

What? [You'll be doing] üëÄ

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing Machine Learning team, comprising of 15 other equally amazing Machine Learning Engineers.

In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast and we'll support your growth ambitions as much as possible. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!

Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to;]


You become a full member of our growing ML Engineering team
You'll work in small teams on ML projects for innovative Dutch & foreign clients in ClimateTech, Mobility and Marketplaces.
You'll develop and implement robust ML applications for these clients
You'll apply your data engineering, computer science and machine learning knowledge on projects and you work with the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow and Kafka
You'll translate the implications of the project to business stakeholders and focus on the human aspects to increase the impact of our ML applications
Together we will keep building our young company Enjins, in which you will play a more and more important role!



Within 1 month you'll:


Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCP
Start your first customer project!



Within 3 months you'll:


Develop and implement robust ML applications for your client, working on building new solutions and ironing out any old integration problems. This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skills.
Had multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skills



Within 6 months you'll:


You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work best
Have helped in the interview process for additional ML Engineers to join Enjins' growing team
Have helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantly



Requirements

About you: üí¨


You have finished your Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or another (technical) degree that is of relevance
You are ambitious and willing to invest in your personal development path towards a Senior ML Engineer
You are pragmatic and proactive and you like to work in small teams for innovative clients
You've excellent communication skills and enjoy translating complex problems to non-tech people
You are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CEO, CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum results
You are fluent in English and are eligible to work in the Netherlands



Your tech skills: üîß


You've extensive software engineering experience in Python, SQL and git. Other languages or frameworks are a big plus
You have experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP) and its data engineering components
You are familiar with software and data engineering concepts like containerization (Kubernetes & Docker), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOps
You have experience with machine learning and know how to create ML models and bring them to production
You are a passionate engineer who 1) wants to make a positive impact to our world and 2) loves discovering new programming languages, frameworks or cloud services. After all, our world is changing continuously!
You've applied the above concepts in one or more relevant (side) jobs



Benefits

What to expect from us: ‚ö°Ô∏è

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
A dedicated training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level
Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities
Receive an Apple MacBook Pro for work
Enjoy 28 vacation days (based on full-time employment), comprising 20 statutory vacation days and an additional 8 days provided by the employer. You have the flexibility to utilise 3 national holidays (Easter Monday, Whit Monday, & Ascension Day) among the 8 days provided.



Have we spiked your interest? üåé

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

What to expect from us: ‚ö°Ô∏è

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:

  • Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
  • Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
  • A dedicated training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level
  • Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

In FRISS, we enable insurers worldwide to automatically detect potential insurance fraud. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Are you ready for an adventure? We are on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer!







Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.







Key Responsibilities:

Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.
Deploy our ML models in the cloud and monitor their performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into products.







Requirements:

Great understanding of and experience in building ML (and deep learning) models.
Excellent programming skills in Python; knowledge in SQL and Py/Spark is a plus.
Hands-on experience with MLOps; CI/CD pipelines, model deployment and monitoring.
Prior work using ML frameworks such as PyTorch (or Keras), Scikit-learn, pandas.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills in English.







Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
Experience with Rest API.
Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.







What We Offer:

A stimulating and innovative work environment.
Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.







Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.




Please note; We are only accepting applications from candidates based in the Netherlands.







About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We‚Äôre currently recruiting a Data Scientist with a strong background in Risk Modeling for a client in the Amsterdam region. This role involves developing advanced models to evaluate credit risk and support portfolio health. By designing and implementing these models, you will enhance the ability to predict default probabilities, assess customer creditworthiness, and contribute to effective risk management strategies.


We are looking for you if you have:

  • +/- 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist in the risk domain;
  • Strong experience with Python and associated data science libraries;
  • Skill in data analysis, machine learning and statistical modeling techniques;
  • Familiarity with Open Banking and its applications in risk assessment.


What they offer:

  • A competitive salary between ‚Ç¨6.000 and ‚Ç¨7.000 (excluding holiday allowance) per month based on knowledge and experience;
  • 25 vacation days and holiday allowance;
  • A well arranged pension plan (4% of gross salary);
  • Fully paid trips abroad;
  • Budget for a personal development plan.


Interested in this role?

The more you tell us about yourself, the better! Upload your CV and we will contact you as soon as possible!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Voor een opdrachtgever ben ik op zoek naar een Data Scientist.


OpdrachtomschrijvingAnalyses van uitgebreide datasets leveren belangrijke opvattingen op voor onze opdrachtgever. Dit houdt in dat grote hoeveelheden ongestructureerde informatie uit diverse bronnen worden verwerkt om zowel hun eigen organisatie als haar klanten optimaal te ondersteunen.

Je maakt gebruik van de nieuwste technologie√´n, waaronder Azure Databricks, om de belangrijkste gegevens te presenteren aan groepen. Je werkt volgens de Agile/Scrum procedure aan verschillende projecten binnen de hele organisatie. Jij draagt de verantwoordelijkheid voor het bouwen en beheren.


Werkzaamheden:

  • Analyseren van data, bijhouden van trends en de bevindingen bespreken met de stakeholders;
  • Samenwerken in data gestuurde teams;
  • Je ondersteunt bij strategische vraagstukken op operationeel niveau.


Functie eisen:

  • Minimaal HBO werk- en denkniveau;
  • Werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie (minimaal 5 jaar);
  • Ervaring met o.a. CI/CD, Scala, Kafka etc;
  • Ervaring met Azure en data-driven Architecture.


Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

  • Salarisindicatie ‚Ç¨ 4.000,- en ‚Ç¨ 6.500,- bruto op basis van 40 uur, afhankelijk aan kennis en ervaring;
  • 25 vakantiedagen;
  • Eindejaarsbonus;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling;
  • Doorgroeimogelijkheden.


üìß cheyenne.eijkhoudt@mcflybrown.com

‚òéÔ∏è 0619028768v

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us:

Toluna is a leading global research and insights provider that empowers clients to make smarter data-driven decisions. Combining our flexible platform, cutting-edge technology, expansive portfolio, and passionate experts, we simplify our clients' work and enable them to deliver greater business impact. ‚Äã

‚Äã

Introduction:

Would you like to become part of a rapidly growing team with an exceptional client roster? We are seeking an ambitious Data Scientist to help drive the success and continued growth of MetrixLab. Primary objective of the role is to help the team design and deliver new analytical solutions to help our roster of clients.




To realize these commercial targets, you will:

Develop and execute marketing research analytical models
Help generate new data driven insights for clients.
Ensure a best fit solution that aligns with the client objective by providing analytic consulting and primary market research expertise
Know the methodology for each analytic techniques and communicate data insights and findings from them
Drive standardization and automation through ML-ops.




Required Skillset:

Degree in Engineering/Maths/Physics is nice to have
2-5 years of experience with marketing data science analysis, with an emphasis on discrete choice modelling/conjoints (in Sawtooth), but also covering max-diffs, drivers analysis, dimensionality reduction
Very good command of English




Our Values:

Acting with Ownership: Demonstrating individual accountability

Bringing a Forward Mindset: Being action-oriented, bold & entrepreneurial

Collaborating with Curiosity: Exhibiting teamwork through togetherness

Discussing openly, committing jointly: Sharing your views openly

Embracing Empathy: Being egoless & caring




What we Offer:

At Toluna, we‚Äôre all about creating a welcoming, diverse workplace where everyone can thrive. We offer competitive pay, great benefits, and plenty of opportunities to grow within our global team. Inclusion and respect are at the heart of what we do. Our community connects over 72 million people across 70 countries. If you‚Äôre passionate about making an impact, we‚Äôd love to have you on board.

A challenging position in a dynamic, fast-paced, innovative, quickly growing global company.
A flexible work environment with a focus on owning and taking pride in your work.
(International) growth opportunities in line with your career ambitions and passions.
Our employees have exclusive access to Udemy Business. With our company license, you have unlimited access to all external courses.
A competitive salary package including a good pension scheme, 25 paid days of leave, and full travel reimbursement (yes, that includes cycling!).

Join our global team. We welcome big thinking and reward great work.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrie√´n te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.




Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.




Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de ‚Ç¨4.000,- en ‚Ç¨5.500,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je √©cht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
uur borreltijd!
Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.




Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe idee√´n te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
Communiceren met klanten.




Gewenste vaardigheden:

Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met data-engineering.
Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.




Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
Ervaring met (web) engineering
ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologie√´n te begrijpen.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.




Onze stack is op dit moment:

Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)

  • Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
  • Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
  • uur borreltijd!
  • Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
  • TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
  • En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.


Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
  • Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
  • Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
  • Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
  • Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe idee√´n te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
  • Communiceren met klanten.


Gewenste vaardigheden:

  • Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
  • Ervaring met data-engineering.
  • Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
  • Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.


Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

  • 2-5 jaar ervaring en een achtergrond in software engineering (backend focus).
  • Ervaring met RAG/agentic applicaties
  • Ervaring met (web) engineering
  • ML/DS staat op tweede plek ten opzichte van de web engineering skill set
  • Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
  • Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
  • Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
  • Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologie√´n te begrijpen.
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.


Onze stack is op dit moment:

  • Backend: Python (FastAPI) (belangrijk)
  • Azure, AWS, Docker, GitHub Actions
  • Frontend: TypeScript (React) (geen must, ervaring wel een plus)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My client in the Agritech space in Amsterdam are looking for an experienced machine learning engineer/data scientist to help them improve their platform and scale to the next level




Responsibilities:




Collaborate in a cross-functional team to build, optimise, evaluate and deploy forecasting algorithms and data visuals of the commercial MVP.
Deploy explainable ML and AI solutions, implement model and data drift monitoring, and develop our processes to enable the team to rapidly productionise new models.
Develop our product analytics system to monitor our performance and drive product development decisions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry developments to always implement the right technology to support our impact.




Requirements:




‚Ä¢ Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a relevant field (AI, Computer Science, Maths, Physics etc.)

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Forecasting is a plus

‚Ä¢ 1+ year experience in machine learning

‚Ä¢ Experience with wearing different hats is a plus




Salary Package:




‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

‚Ä¢ Travel allowance

‚Ä¢ Hybrid working and flexible working hours

‚Ä¢ Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

‚Ä¢ Stock options

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Over Sappi

Sappi Maastricht is een papierproducent die een technologisch hoogwaardig productieproces en constante innovatie inzet voor het maken van een kwalitatief vooraanstaand product. Hierbij staan duurzaamheid en respect voor mens, natuur en milieu voorop. Wij werken met gecertificeerde hernieuwbare grondstoffen en ons product is volledig recyclebaar. De PM6, met een productiecapaciteit van 280.000 ton/jaar, is ƒóƒón van de grootste machines ter wereld voor meervoudig gestreken karton. Op deze machine wordt grafisch en verpakkingskarton voor zowel de grafische als de verpakkingsindustrie geproduceerd.




Bekijk het filmpje (Sappi Europe Papermaking DUTCH (youtube.com)) om een indruk te krijgen van het productie- en verwerkingsproces van papier.




Doel van de functie:




Als ML Engineer bij Sappi Maastricht ben je verantwoordelijk voor het aanpakken van complexe productie-uitdagingen, door het toepassen van AI en machine learning (ML) technologie√´n om productieprocessen te optimaliseren, kosten te verlagen en de productkwaliteit te verbeteren. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende teams om belangrijke bedrijfsproblemen te identificeren en te analyseren, innovatieve ML-oplossingen te ontwikkelen en schaalbare ML- en AI-oplossingen in de dagelijkse operaties te implementeren.







Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden van de functie:




Samenwerken met verschillende teams om belangrijke bedrijfsproblemen te analyseren en innovatieve ML oplossingen te ontwikkelen, waarbij voortdurend waardevolle output wordt geleverd.
Ontwerpen en implementeren van schaalbare Machine Learning en Artificial Intelligence oplossingen in de dagelijkse operaties.
Testen, monitoren en continu verbeteren van ML processen.
Zorgen voor relevante, gedetailleerde en goed gestructureerde data voor analytics.
Toepassen van data science best practices met de focus op data preprocessing, feature engineering en model evaluatie. Mogelijkheden bieden voor snelle prototyping en evaluatie.
Leveren van waardevolle input aan de digitale roadmap voor ons bedrijf dat aansluit bij strategische doelen.
Ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde data-visualisatietools om complexe ML resultaten op een intu√Øtieve en toegankelijke manier te presenteren.
Up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends in ML en AI
Zorgen voor een naadloze integratie van ML modellen in productieomgevingen en het onderhouden van deze modellen om hun prestaties te waarborgen.




Kwalificaties & Ervaring:




Een HBO/Universitaire Bachelor of Master in een relevant vakgebied (computerwetenschappen, statistiek, wiskunde, natuurkunde, techniek)
3 jaar ervaring met het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van schaalbare machine learning oplossingen in cloud computing platforms zoals Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform of AWS
Bewezen expertise in ML-operations en moderne code-ontwikkelingspraktijken met Python. Kennis van andere programmeertalen is een pluspunt
Het vermogen hebben om data effici√´nt te manipuleren met behulp van SQL
Uitstekende samenwerkings- en communicatievaardigheden zowel richting IT- als zakelijke publieksgroepen
Intellectuele nieuwsgierigheid en de bereidheid om buiten je comfortzone te werken.
Vloeiend in het Nederlands en Engels communiceren
Ervaring in een industri√´le werkomgeving is een pr√©







Wij bieden




Naast een vast contract met een marktconform salaris en 37 verlofdagen bieden wij interessante extra‚Äôs zoals een 13e maand, een bonusregeling en een premievrij pensioen.

Sappi ondersteunt zijn medewerkers met opleidingen zodat ze blijven groeien in hun ontwikkeling en zich erkend en gewaardeerd voelen.




Informatie




Nadere informatie over de functie inhoud kan u bekomen bij de heer Bram Goorts, Manager Utilities, tel +31 (0)43 3822 246 en per mail naar bram.goorts@sappi.com




We verwelkomen sollicitanten van elk ras, etniciteit, geslacht, leeftijd, seksuele geaardheid, handicap of achtergrond. Sappi is er trots op een werkgever te zijn die gelijke kansen biedt en discrimineert niet op basis van ras, religie, huidskleur, geslacht, geslachtsidentiteit, seksuele geaardheid, leeftijd, niet-kwalificerende fysieke of mentale handicap, afkomst, veteranenstatus of enig ander wettelijk beschermd kenmerk.




Acquisitie voor deze functie is niet gewenst.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Remote
Description:
Are you passionate about developing intelligent systems and driving innovation through machine learning? We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our talented team remotely. In this role, you will design, implement, and optimize machine learning models that solve complex problems and enhance our clients' capabilities. This position offers a remarkable opportunity to leverage your expertise and contribute to cutting-edge AI projects.

Position Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Employment Type: Full-Time


Your Responsibilities:


Model Development: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to address various business challenges.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful patterns and insights that inform model training and improvement.
Algorithm Optimization: Optimize existing algorithms for better performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product managers to integrate machine learning solutions into products and services.
Research: Stay abreast of the latest research and trends in machine learning and apply relevant advancements to ongoing projects.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of models, algorithms, and processes to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing.
Quality Assurance: Ensure the reliability and robustness of machine learning systems through rigorous testing and validation.


Requirements

Who We're Looking For:


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus.
Professional Experience: Minimum of 2 years experience in machine learning engineering or a similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R, and experienced with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Analytical Thinking: Strong ability to analyze complex data sets and develop actionable insights.
Problem-Solver: Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on innovative solutions.
Communication: Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, capable of explaining complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration: Proven ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams in a remote setting.
Detail-Oriented: Meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Continuous Learner: Eager to stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and AI technologies.


Benefits

Why Choose Us:


Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere while maintaining a healthy work-life balance.
Professional Growth: Access to ongoing training, workshops, and mentorship from industry-leading machine learning professionals.
Career Advancement: Opportunities for promotion and career development within a forward-thinking organization.
Innovative Culture: Be part of a team that values creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement.
Comprehensive Benefits: Receive a competitive benefits package, including health insurance, paid time off, and more.
Impactful Work: Contribute to projects that drive significant advancements and deliver tangible results for clients.


Take the next step in your machine learning engineering career with us. Apply today and be part of a team that is shaping the future of intelligent systems!

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologie√´n zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologie√´n;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van ‚Ç¨ 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • ‚Ç¨ 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My retail client who operate within the fashion retail and e-commerce sector in Den Bosch are on the look out for an experienced data scientist to join their team, to help them embrace the power of data analytics and machine learning!




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement statistical models and machine learning algorithms to solve key business problems such as customer segmentation, demand forecasting, pricing optimization etc.
Design and develop predictive models to forecast demand, inventory levels, sales trends, and customer behavior
Design and implement A/B tests, multivariate tests, and other experimentation strategies
Work with key stakeholders to bring a data-driven culture to the business

Requirements:




‚Ä¢ Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a relevant field (AI, Computer Science, Maths, Physics etc.)

‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience working with data science

‚Ä¢ Affinity for machine learning

‚Ä¢ Experience with forecasting is a plus but not required




Salary Package:




‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨80,000 per annum (D.O.E)

‚Ä¢ Travel allowance

‚Ä¢ Hybrid working and flexible working hours (average 2 days per week in the office)

‚Ä¢ Pension Plan




Make sure to apply here or reach me on the following:




Phone: +31203997864

Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologie√´n zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologie√´n;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van ‚Ç¨ 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • ‚Ç¨ 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carri√®re. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Title: Python Developer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development. The world is how we shape it. Let‚Äôs shape it together.

Job Description

Development community

Our Developers specialise in application and software development while seamlessly integrating systems, so we never lose sight of our business goals. With an eye towards user experience and productivity, you‚Äôll design, code, and test new functionalities while troubleshooting issues, optimizing performance, and keeping technical documentation in order.

Our developers love to design and are always informed of the latest design trends. When fulfilling day-to-day tasks, you‚Äôll always be ready with a solution when there‚Äôs a problem. You‚Äôll also collaborate with other teams and never miss a detail so you can deliver solutions that meet Sopra Steria‚Äôs quality standards.

Qualifications

Our experts speak Python like it‚Äôs a second language and are at home with Python libraries and frameworks like Django, Flask, and Pandas. They‚Äôre also familiar with version control systems like Git, and APIs and web services.

As a Python expert, your fluency in Python is matched by your interpersonal fluency, so problem-solving, debugging, and understanding of object-oriented programming in a collaborative environment are second nature.

With Python, you‚Äôll spend most of your time developing, testing, and deploying applications, as well as automating tasks and performing data analysis.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider. We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That‚Äôs why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers. Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

Want to know what happens next?

The recruitment process typically begins with the first step, where the recruiter screens candidates based on their qualifications and fit for the role. This is followed by the second step, where candidates undergo more in-depth evaluations, including technical assessments and an interview with the capacity manager to assess both technical skills and team compatibility. The third step involves the company reviewing feedback and aligning on a potential offer. Finally, in the final step, the candidate receives a formal job offer.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer/Data Scientist - Utrecht Omgeving - Fulltime




Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in Data Science en ML! Ben jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.




Werkzaamheden:




Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te cre√´ren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologie√´n zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.







Wat zit erin voor jou?




Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen om op te nemen of te verkopen
Korting bij de retailer zelf
Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
Sociaal, ambitieus team, met een passie voor het maken van een business impact!




Wie ben jij?

2+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
Ervaring met MLOps en Git
Kennis van Databricks en Azure een pre
Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Remote
Description:
Are you passionate about developing intelligent systems and driving innovation through machine learning? We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our talented team remotely. In this role, you will design, implement, and optimize machine learning models that solve complex problems and enhance our clients' capabilities. This position offers a remarkable opportunity to leverage your expertise and contribute to cutting-edge AI projects.

Position Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Employment Type: Full-Time


Your Responsibilities:


Model Development: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to address various business challenges.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful patterns and insights that inform model training and improvement.
Algorithm Optimization: Optimize existing algorithms for better performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product managers to integrate machine learning solutions into products and services.
Research: Stay abreast of the latest research and trends in machine learning and apply relevant advancements to ongoing projects.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of models, algorithms, and processes to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing.
Quality Assurance: Ensure the reliability and robustness of machine learning systems through rigorous testing and validation.


Requirements

Who We're Looking For:


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus.
Professional Experience: Minimum of 2 years experience in machine learning engineering or a similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficient in programming languages such as Python or R, and experienced with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Analytical Thinking: Strong ability to analyze complex data sets and develop actionable insights.
Problem-Solver: Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on innovative solutions.
Communication: Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, capable of explaining complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration: Proven ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams in a remote setting.
Detail-Oriented: Meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Continuous Learner: Eager to stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and AI technologies.


Benefits

Why Choose Us:


Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere while maintaining a healthy work-life balance.
Professional Growth: Access to ongoing training, workshops, and mentorship from industry-leading machine learning professionals.
Career Advancement: Opportunities for promotion and career development within a forward-thinking organization.
Innovative Culture: Be part of a team that values creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement.
Comprehensive Benefits: Receive a competitive benefits package, including health insurance, paid time off, and more.
Impactful Work: Contribute to projects that drive significant advancements and deliver tangible results for clients.


Take the next step in your machine learning engineering career with us. Apply today and be part of a team that is shaping the future of intelligent systems!

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologie√´n zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologie√´n;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van ‚Ç¨ 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • ‚Ç¨ 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carri√®re. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 ‚Äì 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Harver

Harver is the industry leading hiring solution helping organizations optimize their talent decisions. Rooted in over 35 years of rich data insights, the company‚Äôs portfolio of solutions enables organizations to make the best talent decisions across the entire employee lifecycle. Having processed over 100 million candidates, Harver provides trusted, flexible, and adaptable offerings making hiring better, faster, and fundamentally more fair. More than 1,300 customers trust Harver to help put purpose to work. ‚ÄØ

At Harver, We


Seek to Connect - Connections hold us together and make us stronger.
Embrace the Present - Candor is crucial. Everyone has a clear view of what we're doing and why it matters.
See it Through - Actions drive outcomes. We each have our role to play and we trust each other to get it done.
Envision What's Beyond - We push ourselves to think past the obvious. Because what got us here, won't get us there.


Job Overview

Harver is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to take ownership of Harver‚Äôs ML-powered applications. The ideal candidate would be experienced in developing, training and deploying ML services in a stable and interpretable fashion to cloud environments. You will be part of Harver‚Äôs Data team and work on delivering new ML driven capabilities, in addition to maintaining and enriching our existing ML capabilities.

In This Role You Get To


Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and product managers for the design, delivery and maintenance of our ML applications
Partner with different teams and domains on designing, explaining and implementing ML models
Play an active role in researching and innovating to find relevant ML use-cases that will play a role in achieving our business objectives


We‚Äôre Looking For People Who Have


At least 2-3 years of experience working with machine learning and related technologies
Has worked toward delivering ML applications to high traffic production environments, including MLOps experience and tools such as MLFlow or SageMaker
Solid experience with Python‚Äôs scientific stack: pytorch, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn or other deep learning frameworks
Cloud experience (AWS) and serverless a plus
Hands-on experience with LLMs, RAG architecture, or agent-based systems.
A good grasp of software engineering fundamentals and best practices


Additionally, It Would Be Nice To Have


Experience working with the AWS cloud in general and Lambda
Familiarity with tools such as Spark/Glue, DBT, Airflow etc.
Some familiarity with Elasticsearch and other database technologies


We Will Offer You


A competitive base salary and an incentive program;
Harver Pension program;
24 days of vacation;
Hybrid work schedules with lots of flexibility;
Summer Fridays - Take half day off on Fridays to rest and recharge;
Monthly connectivity and wellness allowance;
The chance to be a part of a high-performing, highly collaborative environment full of people who love what they do and who are dedicated to success;
A culture focused on achieving results and transparent communication;
A solid, experienced management team invested in your development;
An executive team dedicated to the safety and well-being of all team members.


We are looking for candidates based in the Netherlands within commutable distance to the office in Amsterdam.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist (Innovation Team)
Description:
At a glance

The Detecting Financial Crime ‚Äì Data Science Innovation Team (DFC DSI) is one of the largest and fastest growing data science teams within ABN AMRO. We are working on smart solutions to detect financial crime, including money laundering, terrorist financing and human trafficking. Criminals are never resting and all the time come up with new ways to stay out of sight, so we need to continuously adapt and innovate to beat them to it. Our work is in the full limelights, from the senior management of the bank, the national regulators such as DNB, as well as from society as a whole. This illustrates the important role that we play as gatekeeper of the financial system. In DFC we bring together every activity the bank undertakes to detect financial crime. By combining knowledge, expertise, and joining forces, we can do a better job of keeping our banking systems free of financial crime and embracing new developments.

Your job

The team is responsible for data science innovations to create a future proof DFC and bank in general. Our team‚Äôs current main focus is on transaction monitoring and KYC monitoring but our scope is the broader DFC domain. The DSI team aims to transform the traditional TM and KYC landscape into a 2.0 version by creating state-of-the-art machine learning technologies (e.g. anomaly detection, network analytics, NLP, LLM) that detect financial crime (money laundering, terrorist financing, human trafficking etc.) in an effective way, using machine learning and advanced network analytics as well as genAI features. In collaboration with the business, Compliance and DFC operations you will be responsible for the development and continuous improvement of new transaction monitoring models aimed to detect financial crime. In this process, the data-driven models are continuously being tailored to the needs of the business and the evolving financial crime threats. Being able to interpret the results of the models and to explain the functioning of the models to the stakeholders is key.

Working environment

Financial crime is a hot topic. The media seems to report on money laundering or terrorist financing just about every day. The social relevance of our work is just as important to us. We are the gatekeepers of the financial system, hence responsible for keeping the system safe and healthy, which is of fundamental importance for the stability and security of our clients and ‚Äì by extension- for society as a whole. All of this impacts our relevance as an organisation and our continuity. We accomplish this by lining up the interests of our clients, the bank and society at large. DFC is a relatively new department that is still in the development stage. The fact that the department is in transition will give extra depth to your role. In this dynamic environment, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to help the department get to the next stage and initiate improvements.

Your profile

You are an experienced data scientist with vision. You have excellent analytical skills and get energized by modelling. You can convert a business problem into quantifiable research questions and follow a scientific yet hands-on approach when creating concrete and innovative data science solutions.

You know how to get support for your ideas and advice.


You have a master‚Äôs degree or PhD in computer science/data science or related field and you have 3 - 5 years work experience as a Data Scientist
You have experience in development of machine learning models in a big data environment and experience in productionizing machine learning models.
You are familiar with recent developments in machine learning, knowledge of IT architecture and an experienced Python programmer, preferably also skilled in SQL, PySpark and other technologies
You have strong communication skills and you‚Äôre pro-active
Having working experience within the KYC/CDD/AML domain is beneficial
Living in the Netherlands



We are offering

At DFC, you‚Äôll be working in a driven and dynamic environment, where people work hard based on a shared vision and objective. The DFC department is characterised by a non-hierarchical structure, short lines of communication, a focus on deliverables and close teamwork with other departments. Although we make high demands of our work, we never lose sight of the human dimension because we believe that the success of our mission depends on it. In this work context, we‚Äôll offer you the opportunity to work on your professional and personal development.

Interested?

What are you looking for in the next stage of your career? Turn your goals into reality and work on your professional and personal development. Tell us your story. For more information, please contact Lars Haringa, via lars.haringa@nl.abnamro.com

Equal opportunities for all

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

Title: AI Engineer - Netherlands (Remote)
Description:
Overview:

One of our clients based in California, USA is building a new team and looking for 7 highly skilled and motivated AI Engineers globally to join their dynamic team. As an AI Engineer, you will be pivotal in designing, developing, and deploying state-of-the-art AI solutions that enhance the capabilities of our products and services, driving efficiency and innovation.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement advanced machine learning algorithms to solve complex problems.
Analyze large datasets to extract valuable insights and improve model performance.
Train machine learning models and evaluate their performance using various metrics and methodologies.
Integrate AI solutions into existing systems to enhance functionality and performance.
Stay updated with the latest trends in AI and machine learning, applying this knowledge to drive innovation within the team.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to deliver high-quality AI solutions.
Deploy AI models into production environments, ensuring their ongoing performance and reliability.
Create comprehensive documentation for AI models, algorithms, and systems to facilitate knowledge sharing and maintenance.



Qualifications:


Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java, and strong understanding of machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Demonstrated experience in developing and deploying AI models in a professional setting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience in working with large datasets.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to explain complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to project success.



Preferred Qualifications:


Ph.D. in AI, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience in applying AI techniques in industries such as healthcare, finance, or e-commerce.
Familiarity with big data platforms like Hadoop, Spark, and AWS.
Published research in reputable AI or machine learning conferences or journals.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
HTML:
FOR THIS POSITION YOU HAVE TO SPEAK GERMAN (AT LEAST C1 LEVEL)!


What are you going to do as Junior Data Scientist?

Do you want to use your data skills for advising media companies on their path to the future in the DACH region? Do you want to make a real impact with data? Then you're right with us.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will drive challenging data projects forward together with your project team. You will immediately work with real data and critical problems of our customers. Typical examples include developing recommendation systems, text classification, and churn prediction.

Your clients will be based in the DACH region (Germany, Austria and Switzerland) but your Highberg office will be Amsterdam. So take in mind that you will have to travel for client work to the DACH region and to the Highberg office in Hamburg.

Your work as Junior Data Scientist at #Highberg

You will work for one or more renowned media companies. Together with your Highberg DACH colleagues you will combine our know-how in strategy, organization and data science. The projects revolve around these topics strategies for digital growth, modern and efficient organizations and innovative data science applications.

In data projects, you will demonstrate expertise in developing algorithms, ETL pipelines, or data lakes. You will work together with our customers on an interdisciplinary basis. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Developing technical solutions for our clients' professional challenges;
  • Building ETL processes, data warehouses, and data models;
  • Visualizing and preparing results, as well as deriving action recommendations;
  • Developing and optimizing machine learning models;
  • Deploying in cloud systems and supporting practical tests.

What are we asking?

  • You have just graduated (master degree) or PhD in a quantitative field, e.g., Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Data Science;
  • Eligible to work in the EEA without the need for visa sponsorship;
  • Proficient in English and German language (at least C1 level);
  • Available for ‚â• 4 days a week;
  • Analytical skills, thinking in data and structures;
  • Experience in Python or other programming languages;
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and cloud platforms;
  • Ability to understand complex problems and develop solution approaches with data and algorithms
  • Entrepreneurial mindset.

Who are you?

  • Team-oriented, communicative, and capable of working independently;
  • You are curious and eager to tackle demanding problems;
  • You love data science and develop innovative solutions.

What are we offering?

  • Base salary ranging from EUR 3.382,- to 3.972,- per month and excellent benefits including performance pay, provisions for mobility, pension and leave;
  • Sincere attention to personal development including coaching by colleagues, access to and wide range of education and training and a personal development plan with matching investments;
  • A place within a challenging and growing organization where taking personal responsibility is valued, you have the autonomy and freedom to perform your work flexibly with short lines of communication with colleagues;
  • A pleasant working environment with a pleasant and easily accessible office, focus on performance as a team and not on the individual and numerous social activities such as get-togethers, sports activities and team meetings.

About The Team

From day one, you'll be a member of a team of highly motivated, committed consultants and data scientists. Teamwork is our top priority! We pull together across all consultant levels. No up-or-out, no elbows - just HIGHBERG spirit.

Together as a team, we develop tailored and implementable solutions with our clients. With strategic foresight and analytical acumen, we take our clients' business models to a new level and open up new horizons for them. Working on multiple projects simultaneously provides a challenging work environment with lots of variety and constant challenges. This brings dynamism and fun - there's no trace of boredom here.

Our Tech Stack:

  • Programming languages: Python, R, JavaScript, SQL;
  • ETL / Data Modeling: dbt, Google Dataflow, Pandas;
  • Deployment: Docker, Google Kubernetes Engines, CI / CD;
  • Cloud Platforms: Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services;
  • Databases: BigQuery, ElasticSearch;
  • Data visualization: Tableau, PowerBI, Plotly, Matplotlib, Google Looker Studio;
  • Machine Learning: SciKit, xgboost, NLTK / spaCy, Keras, PyTorch, Prophet;
  • LLM: OpenAI / ChatGPT, Gemini, Huggingface.

About Highberg

Highberg is a group of entrepreneurial consulting firms with best-in-class experience in organizational, sustainability, and digital transformations. As a collective of multidisciplinary and talented boutique consulting companies, we combine our strengths to pursue one ambition: to become the leading transformation consulting group in Europe. We are proud to be a B Corp certified company, as we strive to care for our planet, society, and our employees.

Working at Highberg

At Highberg, we foster a supportive and collaborative culture. This culture is built on our three core values: Be Committed, Be Better, and Be You.

  • In ‚ÄôBe Committed,‚Äô colleagues tirelessly strive for a lasting positive impact on our clients, society, and the environment. We are characterized by our entrepreneurial spirit and our collective commitment to the overall success of the company.
  • ‚ÄôBe Better‚Äô is all about our belief in continuous learning and improvement, and we provide you with opportunities to grow and develop both personally and professionally. We strive for the highest standards of quality and professionalism in everything we do.
  • And last but definitely not least, ‚ÄôBe You‚Äô is about encouraging you to bring your whole self to work, have fun, and embrace diversity and inclusion. We seek to establish personal connections with our clients and colleagues, building long-term, trust-based relationships.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
Be a productive member of the team.


Requirements


Conduct exploratory data analysis on large-scale banking datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and business opportunities.
Leverage Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI to design dashboards and reports, enabling stakeholders to make data-driven decisions.
Develop and validate predictive models using techniques like regression, classification, and clustering for applications such as credit scoring, fraud detection, and customer segmentation.
Experiment with advanced analytics techniques, including deep learning, NLP, and time-series forecasting, to address specific banking challenges.
Build data pipelines and execute ETL processes with Azure Data Factory to prepare both structured and unstructured data for analysis.
Perform feature engineering, data transformation, and data cleaning to enhance model accuracy and resilience.
Work with stakeholders to understand business requirements and convert them into actionable data science solutions.
Collaborate with data engineers, machine learning engineers, and other team members to facilitate the seamless deployment of models into production.
Deploy models using Azure Machine Learning Service and establish monitoring systems to evaluate model performance, making adjustments as needed.
Apply MLOps best practices for model lifecycle management and version control.
Proficiency in Python and machine learning libraries (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow).
Strong SQL skills, with experience using Azure SQL Database or Azure Cosmos DB.
In-depth understanding of statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and banking use cases such as risk scoring and fraud detection.
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Power BI.


Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.
Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: Remote (Sr.) Python Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
About RoomPriceGenie ‚ú®üßû‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Founded in 2017, RoomPriceGenie is dedicated to helping hoteliers around the globe achieve optimal pricing. üåç We understand that many small hotels face challenges with digitalization, making their operations increasingly complex and often resulting in lost revenue. This is where we come in!

We have developed a powerful solution that enables hotels to set the right prices in just seconds. ‚è±Ô∏è Our state-of-the-art algorithm analyzes both internal hotel data and market trends to recommend pricing strategies that enhance revenue and improve booking rates.

With customers spanning the globe‚Äîfrom the USA and Canada to Iceland, South Africa, China, Slovenia, Italy, and the UK‚ÄîRoomPriceGenie has made a meaningful impact in the hospitality industry, and our clients love the results. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Now, we are excited to expand our customer base and spread the word about how we can support hoteliers in optimizing their pricing strategies. We invite you to join us on this journey! We actively encourage applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds to enrich our team and drive innovation.

Join RoomPriceGenie as a Data Scientist Python (Django) (m/f/d)!

Your Role

Are you passionate about building features end-to-end and working with cutting-edge algorithms? At RoomPriceGenie, you‚Äôll:


Develop production-level code and contribute to our core revenue optimization algorithm.
Collaborate with a team of data-loving nerds who enjoy tackling complex challenges.
Work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with Python and Django.
Shape our architecture to support scaling users, features, and data.
Partner closely with Product and Design, owning features from conception to deployment.
Build a strong engineering culture while driving innovation.


Your Profile


5+ years of professional experience with Python.
Strong knowledge of optimization algorithms and libraries like Scipy, Numpy, and Pandas.
An interest in statistics and a knack for problem-solving with numbers.
Expertise in software design principles and development tools like Django.
Excellent communication and a high sense of ownership.


Nice to Have


Located in Mannheim, Germany‚Äîbonus points for local talent!
Hands-on experience with:
Snowflake (and Snowpark), AWS RDS (Postgres), and DocumentDB (MongoDB)
Celery & RabbitMQ for task management
DataDog and SonarQube for monitoring and quality assurance

What We Offer at RoomPriceGenie üí™

At RoomPriceGenie, we don‚Äôt just offer jobs; we offer an adventure! üöÄ Join us in an exciting startup atmosphere where you can grow your career while changing the world for tens of thousands of independent hoteliers. üåç Our global and diverse team is fueled by passion and a shared mission. We thrive in a culture that‚Äôs all about transparency, respect, and making a real impact together.

Here‚Äôs what you can expect when you become part of our Genie family:


Hybrid Office Model: Work your way! Whether you‚Äôre a remote work ninja üñ•Ô∏è, love the hustle of the office üè¢, or enjoy a mix of both, we empower you to choose the setup that suits you best.
One Team, One Vision, One Goal: We‚Äôre in this together! ü§ù Our Genies are laser-focused on our mission, collaborating to make magic happen. ‚ú® It‚Äôs no wonder we score a stellar 9.3 from our team members! üåü
Epic Team Gatherings: Every year, we bring our global crew together üåé for a week of networking, brainstorming, and fun. üéâ Plus, enjoy regular hangouts in our offices to keep the camaraderie alive.
Growth and Development: We‚Äôre all about lifelong learning! üìö Level up your skills with personal and professional development opportunities. You‚Äôll even snag up to three extra days off each year to focus on your growth. üìà
5 Years? 5 Weeks! Stick with us, and we‚Äôll reward your loyalty. After five years, you‚Äôll earn an incredible five weeks of bonus vacation time üèñÔ∏è to recharge and explore the world. üåç

Flexible Hours: We get it‚Äîlife happens! ‚è∞ We offer flexible working hours to help you balance your work and personal life seamlessly.
Wellbeing Matters: Your mental health is a top priority. üßò Every Genie gets access to Headspace, the leading meditation app, to help you cultivate a happier, healthier, and more zen life. üåø

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Operations
Description:
What You Will Do

As a Junior Data Scientist (Operations) at Wundermart, you will be part of the Shop Intelligence team, a dynamic group dedicated to empowering the organization with data-driven decisions and improving and automating various processes. You will collaborate closely with Wunder Services, which includes the Operations, Buying, and Supplier Management teams, while your primary focus will be on optimizing supply chain efficiency, enhancing supplier performance, and driving cost savings across our network of over 200 shops.

Your role will involve leveraging data to develop and implement strategies that improve supplier relationships, optimize inventory management, and streamline buying processes. You will design experiments, build predictive models, and automate key operational processes, ensuring scalability across our international operations. Success in this role will require strong analytical skills, experience in data science projects, and the ability to work cross-functionally.

As part of the Shop Intelligence team, you will also collaborate with other members responsible for Assortment, Price, Promotion, and Routing & Placement, contributing to a holistic, data-driven approach across the organization.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement data-driven strategies to optimize supplier performance, inventory management, and buying processes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform operational decisions.
Design, test, and analyze various operational strategies, and communicate the outcomes to stakeholders.
Develop and deploy statistical models and algorithms to predict demand, assess supplier risk, and optimize buying strategies.
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and reliability by implementing robust quality control measures.
Create and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations to clearly communicate findings and recommendations.
Roll out successful projects across multiple countries, ensuring consistency and scalability, such as:
Optimal routing and ordering
Developing automated planograms
Automated inbound and outbound flows
Optional: Apply machine learning techniques to enhance predictive modeling and automate supply chain processes.

What You Can Bring


A passion for data, complex analyses, and deriving actionable insights from them.
Background in econometrics, operations research, data science, business analytics, or IT.
1-2 years of experience in data scientist roles.
Good to haves:
Experience in predictive modeling, including topics like demand forecasting, clustering, and optimization algorithms.
Proficiency in programming statistical analyses in R or Python is preferred.
Ideally you have affinity for or experience in a supply chain or operational environment, preferably within retail or e-commerce.
Experience designing and conducting experiments, such as A/B tests, is a plus.
Affinity with operations research and supply chain management is a plus.
Experience with machine learning is a plus.
Experience with Power BI or similar tools is a plus.
Proficiency in English (Dutch is a plus).
You live at a commutable distance from our HQ in Amsterdam.

What We Have To Offer.


Opportunity for growth and professional development in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Flexible working arrangements.
Unlimited vacation days.
Travel reimbursement.
Regular team events.
Lunch at our HQ in Amsterdam.
...and more.


Wundermart is not just your ordinary workplace ‚Äì we are a vibrant community driven by innovation, collaboration, and a shared passion for data-driven excellence. As a rapidly growing company, we are dedicated to creating an environment where our team members can thrive personally and professionally. Our company motto is ‚Äònever settle‚Äô. We encourage our employees to be open minded and listen to each other. To dare to make mistakes, bringing new insight moving forward. To take ownership of our work and always look for opportunities to create better solutions for existing problems.
